channel.title: Important news, the admins need to read this
channel.description:
A couple of minutes ago Mark Gore (TX) attacked a rsps community (google) by hacking a global mod and pruning most of the RSPS dev sections threads, i suggest you to IP him as he is on MITB and moparscape too. Edit: Quote from the global mod:
Users of Rune-Server EDIT: Looks like RS2 is being pruned. Apparently its an on going thing when they had control over my account. Its been pruning since. I can not stop this. Yes, I got "hacked" by T X,. It was a fault of my own. I was stupid enough to have done some thing. To every user who was supporting TX please notice that we know who you are. I had several people take note of every one who supported this, Those who sent me a PM asking to be "part of this" will receive a ban to. If you notice any thing wrong or out of place please contact a member of staff, We would like it if we could keep discussion to this as minimum as possible. I would like to say thank you to every one who helped and is reporting. Your help is greatly appreciated and wont go unheard of. * Vegeta * Torag * DJ Dan * Mark * Cascade * Sub? (Ill build on it) Thanks, Mint. Edit: If any one does get hacked by the "The hardstyle raving hacking group" you know who to blame now.

item.title: Important news, the admins need to read this
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yz85Racer:

I don’t see how this is relevant, if you’re a staff member on this forum, you are atleast smart enough to not let some idiot get your password.

That is pretty much true, at least I would like to think so. If not, however, I do have code in place to ‘undo’ most any action a moderator can do back to any time I specify (so nothing would be lost or affected), and worst comes to worst, if an admin’s password was compromised and everything was destroyed, I have weekly backups of the database so the most we would lose would be 7 days.

Basically, I’m not as stupid or careless as some other admins out there.

Read full topic
item.source: Important news, the admins need to read this

item.title: Important news, the admins need to read this
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:17, topic:271970”][quote author=jme link=topic=358824.msg2744576#msg2744576 date=1239554468]
Someone got my password in 07. Not because of keyloggers or anything, I just don’t have a clue how they managed to get it. However it was short, no caps, no numbers…

All they did was solve some post reports and delete gikids posts, lol. Since then I have a very secure password.

[/quote]Let me guess…weed. Or some kind of drug spinoff.[/quote]

Was actually an old pet’s name… lol

Read full topic

item.title: Important news, the admins need to read this
item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

A couple of minutes ago Mark Gore (TX) attacked a rsps community (google) by hacking a global mod and pruning most of the RSPS dev sections threads, i suggest you to IP him as he is on MITB and moparscape too.

Edit:
Quote from the global mod:

Users of Rune-Server EDIT: Looks like RS2 is being pruned. Apparently its an on going thing when they had control over my account. Its been pruning since. I can not stop this.

Yes, I got “hacked” by T X,. It was a fault of my own. I was stupid enough to have done some thing.

To every user who was supporting TX please notice that we know who you are. I had several people take note of every one who supported this, Those who sent me a PM asking to be “part of this” will receive a ban to.

If you notice any thing wrong or out of place please contact a member of staff, We would like it if we could keep discussion to this as minimum as possible.

I would like to say thank you to every one who helped and is reporting. Your help is greatly appreciated and wont go unheard of.

* Vegeta
* Torag
* DJ Dan
* Mark
* Cascade
* Sub?

(Ill build on it)

Thanks, Mint.

Edit: If any one does get hacked by the “The hardstyle raving hacking group” you know who to blame now.

Read full topic
